verses.verse: I am come <S%H935><s%> into my garden <S%H1588><s%>, my sister <S%H269><s%>, my bride <S%H3618><s%>: I have gathered <S%H717><s%> my myrrh <S%H4753><s%> with my spice <S%H1313><s%>; I have eaten <S%H398><s%> my honeycomb <S%H3293><s%> with my honey <S%H1706><s%>; I have drunk <S%H8354><s%> my wine <S%H3196><s%> with my milk <S%H2461><s%>. Eat <S%H398><s%>, O friends <S%H7453><s%>; Drink <S%H8354><s%>, yea <S%H7937><s%>, drink abundantly, O beloved <S%H1730><s%>.

I was asleep <S%H3463><s%>, but my heart <S%H3820><s%> waked <S%H5782><s%>: It is the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my beloved <S%H1730><s%> that knocketh <S%H1849><s%>, saying <S%H6605><s%>, Open to me <S%H269><s%>, my sister, my love <S%H7474><s%>, my dove <S%H3123><s%>, my undefiled <S%H8535><s%>; For my head <S%H7218><s%> is filled <S%H4390><s%> with dew <S%H2919><s%>, My locks <S%H6977><s%> with the drops <S%H7447><s%> of the night <S%H3915><s%>.

I have put off <S%H6584><s%> my garment <S%H3801><s%>; How <S%H349><s%> shall I put it on <S%H3847><s%>? I have washed <S%H7364><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%>; how <S%H349><s%> shall I defile them <S%H2936><s%>?
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> put in <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> by <S%H4480><s%> the hole <S%H2356><s%> of the door <S%H4578><s%>, And my heart was moved for him <S%H1993><s%>.

I rose up <S%H6965><s%> to open <S%H6605><s%> to my beloved <S%H1730><s%>; And my hands <S%H3027><s%> dropped <S%H5197><s%> with myrrh <S%H4753><s%>, And my fingers <S%H676><s%> with liquid <S%H5674><s%> myrrh <S%H4753><s%>, Upon the handles <S%H3709><s%> of the bolt <S%H4514><s%>.

I opened <S%H6605><s%> to my beloved <S%H1730><s%>; But my beloved <S%H1730><s%> had withdrawn <S%H2559><s%> himself <S%H5674><s%>, and was gone. My soul <S%H5315><s%> had failed <S%H3318><s%> me when he spake <S%H1696><s%>: I sought <S%H1245><s%> him <S%H4672><s%>, but I could not find him <S%H7121><s%>; I called him <S%H6030><s%>, but he gave me no answer.

The watchmen <S%H8104><s%> that go about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> me <S%H5221><s%>, They smote me <S%H6481><s%>, they wounded me <S%H8104><s%>; The keepers of the walls <S%H2346><s%> took away <S%H5375><s%> my mantle from me <S%H7289><s%>.

I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you <S%H1323><s%>, O daughters of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, If ye find <S%H4672><s%> my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, That ye tell <S%H5046><s%> him <S%H2470><s%>, that I am sick from love <S%H160><s%>.

What is thy beloved <S%H1730><s%> more than another beloved <S%H1730><s%>, O thou fairest <S%H3303><s%> among women <S%H802><s%>? What is thy beloved <S%H1730><s%> more than another beloved <S%H1730><s%>, That thou <S%H3602><s%> dost so adjure us <S%H7650><s%>?
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is white <S%H6703><s%> and ruddy <S%H122><s%>, The chiefest <S%H1713><s%> among ten thousand <S%H7233><s%>.
His head <S%H7218><s%> is as the most <S%H3800><s%> fine gold <S%H6337><s%>; His locks <S%H6977><s%> are bushy <S%H8534><s%>, and black <S%H7838><s%> as a raven <S%H6158><s%>.
His eyes <S%H5869><s%> are like doves <S%H3123><s%> beside the water <S%H4325><s%> - brooks <S%H650><s%>, Washed <S%H7364><s%> with milk <S%H2461><s%>, and fitly set <S%H3427><s%>.

His cheeks <S%H3895><s%> are as a bed <S%H6170><s%> of spices <S%H1314><s%>, As banks of sweet <S%H4840><s%> herbs <S%H4026><s%>: His lips <S%H8193><s%> are as lilies <S%H7799><s%>, dropping <S%H5197><s%> liquid <S%H5674><s%> myrrh <S%H4753><s%>.

His hands <S%H3027><s%> are as rings <S%H1550><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> set <S%H4390><s%> with beryl <S%H8658><s%>: His body <S%H4578><s%> is as ivory <S%H8127><s%> work <S%H6247><s%> overlaid <S%H5968><s%> with sapphires <S%H5601><s%>.

His legs <S%H7785><s%> are as pillars <S%H5982><s%> of marble <S%H8336><s%>, set <S%H3245><s%> upon sockets <S%H134><s%> of fine gold <S%H6337><s%>: His aspect <S%H4758><s%> is like Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>, excellent <S%H977><s%> as the cedars <S%H730><s%>.

His mouth <S%H2441><s%> is most sweet <S%H4477><s%>; Yea <S%H4261><s%>, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, and this is my friend <S%H7453><s%>, O daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>.
